Thanks to @RepCasten, @RepSlotkin, @RepGilCisneros, @RepMaxRose, and @chelliepingree for joining me to introduce the FLAT Prices Act in the House. 

@SenatorDurbin, a long-time leader on fair Rx drug costs, introduced the bill in the Senate. I'm proud to join him in this effort.

We need common-sense solutions to lower healthcare costs. Addressing the rising cost of Rx drugs is a step we can take right now. 

Today, I introduced the FLAT Prices Act to help prevent abusive drug companies from jacking up drug prices on the American people. #mepolitics pic.twitter.com/krxR9U23pc

How do corporations get away with this? 

When they develop a new drug, the gov‚Äôt gives Rx companies a years-long monopoly. They can skyrocket prices with no competition. It‚Äôs a system intended to promote R&D, but many pharma companies abuse it on the backs of Maine people.

Rx drug prices have been out of control for years, but in 2016 we saw just how abusive drug companies had become. In the space of 9 years, amid record profits, Mylan shot its prices for the life-saving allergy drug Epipen up by 400% https://www.nbcnews.com/business/economy/epipen-price-hike-has-parents-kids-allergies-scrambling-ahead-school-n633071¬†‚Ä¶

Higher Rx drug prices are one of the biggest drivers of rising healthcare costs. Maine people spend at least twice as much on prescription drugs as we did thirty years ago. 

Democrats, Republicans, and everyone in between agrees: this is a problem & we need to fix it. pic.twitter.com/RrQ0Xc1IK7

I met with the Maine Medical Association to discuss how we can make healthcare more affordable for Maine people. 

One thing I brought up: the cost of prescription drugs. Year after year, Mainers get soaked by high drug prices. It's past time our country addressed this issue. pic.twitter.com/DbZecil8Oe

Heading into tonight's #SOTU2019, I was looking for areas where I could work with the president to get things done for Maine people. 

Here's what I took from the speech:  https://bit.ly/2t5h6S5¬†
#MEpolitics

We‚Äôre hearing the president will call for both parties to put aside their differences & come together. I welcome that message, but he has to back it up with leadership. We need to see concrete proposals from @POTUS and willingness to work with both parties to get this done 11/

That‚Äôs why Maine needs strong federal funding to build infrastructure that grows our economy, creates good jobs, & connects our businesses and homes. I‚Äôll be listening for @POTUS to seize the moment, work across the aisle, and outline a real infrastructure plan. #mepolitics 10/

Here‚Äôs the thing: Maine isn‚Äôt NY or CA and we‚Äôre more than 90% small biz. An infrastructure plan that requires private investment and lots of state and local gov‚Äôt $$$ won‚Äôt work here. #mepolitics 9/

Investing in infrastructure is huge for #ME02. We‚Äôre 1 of the most rural districts in the US, & we‚Äôre the biggest east of the Mississippi. Bad roads, bridges, rail, & poor broadband internet access quite literally hold our families, workers, & businesses back. #mepolitics 8/

Here‚Äôs another area where I want to work with the president: INFRASTRUCTURE. There‚Äôs a real opportunity here for both parties to work together with @POTUS and get something done for Mainers. Few states would benefit more from better roads, bridges, etc than Maine. #mepolitics 7/

I‚Äôll work with @POTUS when his policies help Mainers, but I‚Äôll fight back when his policies hurt our state. I‚Äôll work with the president to overhaul NAFTA if he's serious about protecting Maine jobs, but this deal comes up short. 6/ #mepolitics #replaceNAFTA pic.twitter.com/41aiZiIWpA

.@POTUS' NAFTA 2.0 must be changed to do more to keep good jobs in Maine and increase wages. And trade deals aren‚Äôt worth the paper they‚Äôre written on if other countries don‚Äôt play by the rules, so we need stronger enforcement provisions. #mepolitics 5/

The president‚Äôs NAFTA 2.0 proposal appears to be more of the same. It looks like a new paint job on the old NAFTA, not the meaningful change we need. Too many Maine communities know where this path leads: closed mills, outsourcing, and low wage jobs. #mepolitics 4/

One thing Cynthia & I have been talking about: the president's #NAFTA plans. We agree with @POTUS that NAFTA's a bad deal for American workers.

NAFTA's been a disaster for Maine's working folks. It needs a full overhaul that addresses the agreement‚Äôs root problems #mepolitics 3/
